page.title: 09WALKINGTON LAND USE & FARMS.
page.content: ABOUT 92% OF OUR AREA IS PRODUCTIVE FARMLAND,4% WOODS AND PARKLAND USED AS PHEASANT SHOOTS,THE OTHER 4% BEING THE VILLAGE. THE LAND TO THE EAST IS HEAVY CLAY LOAM RISING THROUGH A MEDIUM LOAM TO A SILTY CLAY LOAM,WITH FLINTS,ON THE HIGHER WOLD.NEAR THE VILLAGE THE CHALK IS 16ft BELOW THE SURFACE SO HEAVY LAND IS DRAINED.MANY FARMS HAVE UNUSED WELLS AND OLD PONDS,ALL NOW USE MAINS WATER OFTEN EVEN LED TO THE FIELDS. THERE IS LITTLE VANDALISM,BUT SOME TRESPASS AND PEOPLE DISTURBING ANIMALS WHILE WALKING THEIR DOGS. ONE FARM ISN'T WORKED BY THE RESIDING FAMILY,THIS IS PART OF A COMPANY AND WORKED FROM ANOTHER FARM.2 OTHER FARMS ARE WORKED AS ONE UNIT BY BROTHERS. THE FARMS AVERAGE 290 ACRES,WITH 26.5 ACRE AVERAGE FIELDS,1 MAN TO 109 ACRES AND 1 TRACTOR TO EVERY 96.6 ACRES.
